resource_dependency.layout_stylesheet: CSS file defining light goldenrod background for main layout sections
resource_dependency.button_card_styles: CSS classes applying olive drab color to buttons and card components

function: Define global styling for consistent UI theme across the application
static_description: The page uses a light goldenrod background for the main layout container. All interactive buttons and content cards utilize an olive drab color scheme.

resource_dependency.category_filter_schema: Database table 'categories' with fields: id (UUID), name (string)
resource_dependency.poem_data_schema: Table 'poems' with fields: id (UUID), title (string), content (text), category_id (foreign key to categories.id), author_id (foreign key to users.id), created_at (timestamp)

function: Allow users to browse poetry posts organized by categories
static_description: A grid-based layout displays poetry cards grouped under category tabs or filters. Each card shows poem title, excerpt, author name, and category tag using olive drab styling.

interaction_and_states.description: Selecting a category tab reloads the poetry grid to show only poems from that category via fetching from /api/poems?category=:id

function: Enable users to search for specific poetry content by keywords and optional category filter
static_description: A search bar positioned at the top of the page includes a magnifying glass icon referenced as 'search_icon_resource'. It contains placeholder text prompting keyword input.

interaction_and_states.description: Submitting the search triggers a GET request to 'search_api_endpoint', updating the displayed results dynamically without full page reload.

resource_dependency.user_model_schema: Users table with id (UUID), username (unique string), email (unique string), password_hash (string), created_at (timestamp)

function: Implement secure user authentication system enabling registered users to log in and access protected features
static_description: Login/signup modal forms display standard fields: username/email and password inputs. Olive drab colored submit buttons are present along with links to switch between login and registration modes.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking the login button submits credentials to '/api/auth/login'; successful responses store JWT token client-side for future authenticated requests.

function: Provide authenticated users with a form to publish new poetry submissions
static_description: Form includes labeled input fields for title, multi-line content area, and dropdown selector populated with available categories. Submit button styled in olive drab.

interaction_and_states.description: Upon clicking the submit button, form data is validated and sent via POST to '/api/poems'. Success redirects user back to browse view or displays confirmation message.

resource_dependency.comment_data_schema: Comments table with id (UUID), poem_id (foreign key to poems.id), user_id (foreign key to users.id), content (text), created_at (timestamp)

function: Allow logged-in users to read and add comments on individual poetry posts
static_description: Below each poem display, thereâ€™s a comment section showing existing comments with usernames and timestamps. An input field allows adding new comments with an olive drab post button.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking the comment submit button sends a POST request to '/api/comments' with associated poem ID and comment content after validating user session.

resource_dependency.db_connection_config: PostgreSQL connection using DB_HOST=localhost, DB_PORT=5432, DB_USERNAME=myappuser, DB_PASSWORD=myapppassword, DB_NAME=myapp
resource_dependency.schema_creation_instructions: Create tables: users(id UUID PK, ...), poems(id UUID PK, ...), comments(id UUID PK, ...), categories(id UUID PK, name TEXT UNIQUE)

function: Establish structured storage for all core entities including users, poems, comments, and categories
static_description: Relational database schema designed to support associations among users, their authored poems, categorized groupings, and threaded discussions through comments.

function: Expose RESTful interfaces for managing poetry lifecycle operations such as creation, reading, updating, and deletion
static_description: Defined set of HTTP endpoints supporting standard CRUD semantics for poems, secured where appropriate by authentication middleware checks.

function: Serve endpoints handling user identity verification and session persistence
static_description: Collection of authentication-related routes returning tokens upon successful login/registration and validating sessions during protected resource access.

resource_dependency.filter_logic_spec: Full-text search on poem titles and contents; optional filtering by category ID

function: Support flexible querying mechanism to retrieve relevant poetry based on textual match and categorical constraints
static_description: Search endpoint accepts query strings and optional category identifiers to refine returned poetry matches accordingly.

resource_dependency.package_json_structure: { "scripts": { "install:all": "cd frontend && npm install && cd ../backend && npm install", "dev": "concurrently \"cd frontend && npm run dev\" \"cd backend && npm run dev\"" } }

function: Configure unified development workflow scripts within package.json for simultaneous frontend/backend setup and execution
static_description: Root-level package.json defines two custom commands: 'install:all' which sequentially installs frontend and backend dependencies, and 'dev' which runs both environments concurrently.
